captions.text:
In today's video I'm going to be showing you
how to prep your nails perfectly for polishing.

Ever dreamt of having your polish apply smoothly
and last as long as possible? I'll show you
how to do that in 5 easy steps!

Step 1-- remove any old polish left on your
nails. When I'm looking to change up my nail

color or remove old leftover polish I always
go for a non-acetone remover to take it off.

This is because it's a gentler formula and
it's less drying than those containing acetone.

Step 2 is about taking care of your cuticles.
Having them neat and well kept is the key

to a beautiful manicure. Begin by applying
your favorite cuticle oil to your cuticles

and then massage it into your skin and allow
it to soak in for a minute. Then use a cuticle

pusher to push back your cuticles for a neat
appearance. You find wooden and metal ones

similar to this, but I personally prefer these
rubber ones.

Step 3-- shape all your nails to a similar
length and buff the surface. When shaping

your nails, always remember to go in one direction
for a smooth and clean shape. Sawing back

and forth can cause splitting. I also like
to use the buff and polish sides on a four

sided buffer block to smooth out the surface
of my nails for even polish application. You

only want to do this for a few seconds and
once in a while so that your nails keep their

strength and don't become thin. Once you're
done the filing and buffing, it's a good time

to wash your hands to remove any leftover
particles from your nails.

Step 4--- my favorite! Time for some serious
pampering. My holy grail nail care product

has to be burt's bees lemon cuticle cream.
I massage it into all of my cuticles and nails

and it adds in so much moisture and you can
visibly see the difference after giving it

a few minutes to soak in. Don't you hate it
when you hit your nail off something and you're

left with one of these white marks? It drives
me crazy waiting for it to grow out haha.

Now is also a great time to use your favorite
hand cream. Then give yourself sometime to
relax and allow those products to soak in.

Step 5 is all about the base. A very important
step to having your manicure last as long

as possible is wiping your nails down your
nails witth polish remover to remove excess

oils before applying the base coat. Then apply
your favorite base coat over your nails to

protect them from being stained by coloured
polish. This is a ridge filling one which

is why it's a little milky looking. This,
plus the buffing we did earlier, really helps
your polish to go on very smoothly.

And that's it! Your nails are all ready for
the best manicure of their life. If you'd

like to learn how to polish your nails perfectly
too, I have a video on that linked in the
description box below.
Take care guys, and I'll seeya next time!
